self.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

classes.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings. Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v2.0, Section 3.1)
classes.label: General Observations
classes.name: General Observations

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology
Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

datasets.datasetStructure: One record per test per specimen material type per observation time per subject

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all application or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSEQ

datasetVariables.description: The sequence number must be unique for each record within a USUBJID.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: GVSEQ

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: GVGRPID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVREFID

datasetVariables.description: Slide or gel label. Examples: 1101-1 or 1101-2 for the first and second slides for animal 1101 or 1101A and 1101B respectively, or sample label for flow cytometry results. May be blank for example when the record represents an animal level result.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Identifier
datasetVariables.name: GVREFID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Example: Line number on the Lab page.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: GVSPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVTESTCD

self.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in GVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in GVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). GVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: NCE, PCE.
datasetVariables.label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name
datasetVariables.name: GVTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVTEST

datasetVariables.description: Long name for GVTESTCD. The value in GVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Normochromatic Erythrocytes, Immature Erythrocytes .
datasetVariables.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
datasetVariables.name: GVTEST

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVCAT

datasetVariables.description: Assay Type - IN VIVO COMET, IN VIVO MICRONUCLEUS.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Genetox In-Vivo Test
datasetVariables.name: GVCAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Analysis Intention: Cytotoxicity, Genotoxicity.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Genetox In-Vivo Test
datasetVariables.name: GVSCAT

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVORRES

datasetVariables.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Findings as Collected
datasetVariables.name: GVORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVORRESU

datasetVariables.description: The unit for the original result. The unit of the original result should be mapped to a synonymous unit on the Controlled Terminology list.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Original Result
datasetVariables.name: GVORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from GVORRES in a standard format or standard units. GVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in GVSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Character Format
datasetVariables.name: GVSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for numeric results or findings in standard format; contains the numeric form of GVSTRESC. GVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Numeric Format
datasetVariables.name: GVSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for GVSTRESC and GVSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Standardized Result
datasetVariables.name: GVSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate when a test is not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in GVORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: GVSTAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why GVSTAT is NOT DONE, such as BROKEN EQUIPMENT or SPECIMEN LOST.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: GVREASND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C77529

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSPEC

datasetVariables.description: Defines the type of tissue, organ, or fluid specimen used as the object for the finding. Examples: "WHOLE BLOOD", "BONE MARROW", "BONE MARROW, FEMUR".
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Material Type
datasetVariables.name: GVSPEC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVANTREG

datasetVariables.description: Defines the specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue, organ specimen, or the region from which the specimen was obtained, such as a section or part of what is defined in the GVSPEC variable. If the anatomical region is not included in the specimen description GVSPEC, it may be included in this variable. This field can be a combination of terms where needed. This field can be null if not applicable. Examples: CORTEX, MEDULLA, MUCOSA, SEROSA, ISLET, ZONA FASICULATA, ZONA RETICULARIS, CRANIAL, MEDIAN, ACCESSORY, SPINAL, LUMBAR, FRONTAL.
datasetVariables.label: Anatomical Region of Specimen
datasetVariables.name: GVANTREG

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSPCCND

datasetVariables.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Example: CLOTTED, etc.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Condition
datasetVariables.name: GVSPCCND

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVSPCUFL

datasetVariables.description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. Should be N if the specimen is not usable; otherwise it should be null.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
datasetVariables.name: GVSPCUFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVLAT

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for laterality of the specimen within the subject for paired specimens. Examples: LEFT, RIGHT, BILATERAL.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Laterality within Subject
datasetVariables.name: GVLAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVDIR

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for directionality of the specimen within the subject. Examples: DORSAL, PROXIMAL.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Directionality within Subject
datasetVariables.name: GVDIR

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: flow cytometry, microscopy, fluorescent microscopy etc.
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariables.name: GVMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVBLFL

datasetVariables.description: A baseline indicator may be used to calculate differences or changes from baseline. Value should be Y or null. The baseline flag is sponsor defined.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: GVBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVFAST

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. The value should be Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Fasting Status
datasetVariables.name: GVFAST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: GVDRVFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVEXCLFL

datasetVariables.description: Y if the result should be excluded from all calculations, otherwise null.
datasetVariables.label: Exclusion Flag
datasetVariables.name: GVEXCLFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVREASEX

datasetVariables.description: The reason the result should be excluded from all calculations. Used only when GVEXCLFL is Y.
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion
datasetVariables.name: GVREASEX

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVUSCHFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicates whether the timing of the specimen collection was unscheduled. If a specimen collection was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
datasetVariables.name: GVUSCHFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time in ISO 8601 format. For live subjects, this is the date/time of specimen collection or observation. For post-mortem specimen collection, this is the date/time of death.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: GVDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of the specimen collection in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: GVDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVNOMDY

datasetVariables.description: The nominal study day used by data-collection and reporting systems for grouping records for observations that may be scheduled to occur on different days into a single study day (such as for output on a tabulation report). It should be an integer. Best practice is to utilize the first day of data collection for interval attempting to group.
datasetVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
datasetVariables.name: GVNOMDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVNOMLBL

datasetVariables.description: GVNOMLBL is to provide additional information needed to further clarify content of GVNOMDY for Grouping. GVNOMLBL should not duplicate any other information in another variable for that record, and should only be populated when additional information is needed to further clarify content of GVNOMDY for grouping and is useful.
datasetVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
datasetVariables.name: GVNOMLBL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text Description of time when specimen should be taken. \n This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See GVTPTNUM and GVTPTREF. Examples: Start of dosing, 5 min post dosing.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: GVTPT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of GVTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: GVTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (GVTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-P15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by GVTPTREF, or "P8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by GVTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: GVELTM

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by GVELTM, if used for GVTPTNUM, and GVTPT. Examples: Day 28 DOSE.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: GVTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable GV.GVRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the reference time point, GVTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: GVRFTDTC

datasets.label: Genetic Toxicology - In Vivo
datasets.name: GV

classes.description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, FINDINGS, 2021-09-24)
classes.label: Findings
classes.name: Findings

description: This document is the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology (SENDIG-Genetox) for nonclinical studies. SENDIG-Genetox is intended to guide the organization, structure, and format of standard nonclinical tabulation datasets from in vivo genetic toxicology studies being exchanged between organizations such as sponsors and contract research organizations (CROs), and for submission to regulatory authorities such as the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA)
label: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Genetic Toxicology
name: SENDIG-GeneTox v1.0
